readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant patient care
body:
I've just finished 8 weeks light treatment at the dermatology department. The staff here have been amazing. They have been such a great support during this treatment and incredibly caring and dedicated in ensuring patient well being -  thank you!

Steve

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor, no communication
body: No communication, still waiting for my prescription to be amended, been waiting six months now even though told on numerous occasions it would be done. Also waiting for a nurse to ring regarding results that was over a week ago. I was misdiagnosed over 5 years ago which wasted countless hours visiting the hospital only to go back to the practise to be looked at properly by the only doctor they seem to have which is willing to take the time to do the job correctly. This sort of laziness is what costs the nhs mass amounts of money.

title: Service above and beyond
body:
Just want to say thank you to Nurse Practitioner who went further than required to sort out an injection, keeping us informed, looking at alternatives to progress issue.
Understanding that when things involve a person with learning difficulties and autism they can become very stressed when things don't go exactly to plan. Dealt with everything brilliantly.
Thank You so much

title: good practice
body: It was kind of good because they were kind and punctual. I really never had a problem or anything with them. So i think everything was wel.

title: In House Chemist
body: After seeing the Dr, I have to go to the pharmacist to place my order. To which many items are not available. This means I cannot start my medication straight away. My surgery has room to place a chemist inside the building. After talking to the staff, Dr’s and doing a survey within the surgery, I/We have come to the conclusion that everyone would benefit from one being on-site. My local Wells Chemist is struggling everyday fitting in the amount of prescriptions they receive, This would ease their workload at Wells. also make it easier for patients to order and collect their own prescriptions at the surgery. I am disabled also a carer for my wife who has dementia/ epilepsy. This would make my time easier for placing and collecting our prescriptions.

title: Outstanding Practice
body:
I moved to Ringwood just under a year
ago and am a patient at this practice.
I am beyond pleased with the service
I have received from all areas of the medical centre and the pharmacy nextdoor.
They are friendly considerate and caring all round and any health problems have
been progressive with a specialist seen
and results from this came to me in
a good clear format.
Excellent medical practice

title: Well Done Richmond Surgery
body: We had to attend the surgery today for childhood immunisations. I felt the measures put in place to minimise the risk of spread of Covid-19 were very good and this was reassuring in what is a very unsettling time.  The staff we encountered continued to be very professional, efficient and friendly despite these difficult circumstances. Well done Richmond Surgery!

title: Very professional and kind staff.
body: I have visited this clinic after my medical abortion failed at 9 weeks. I had another scan and I was 13 weeks pregnant and my only option was surgical abortion. On the day I was very stressed and frightened ! All staff was very friendly and explained me each step. The procedure itself was very quick. I don’t remember anything. When I woke up, I was offered coffee and biscuits. Also the heat pad was great. Thank you again!

title: Excellent practice.
body:
I would like to say that the Drs and staff are doing an excellent job at this very bad time ,they are keeping calm and friendly.
Thank you.

title: Excellent Service
body: THANK YOU to the 111 Service who dealt with my problem politely, friendly and promptly. It was not Coronavirus related, so I was extremely surprised to receive such quick results. Superb lady Doctor who sent through a prescription to my local pharmacy. Sadly, I didn’t get your name but sincere ‘thanks’. :-)

title: Well Done
body: I was very impressed today to receive a call from the GP Pharmacist to enquire about my medicatons, they still had time to think about patients in these trying times. THANK YOU.

title: Excellant service
body: I have been with the surgery for nearly 20 years and I cannot praise them enough. The receptionists are very helpful when arranging appointments as well as are flexible when re-arranging. Every member of the staff is polite, professional and extremely helpful. They are very attentive and listen to each detail. One thing I really like about the surgery is that they open from 8am to 8pm, seven days a week, which I find very convenient. I would highly recommend the surgery.

title: Great hospital
body:
The staff were extremely helpful and reassuring when I went for an MRI and I found the hospital well protected from the current threat
Thank you Peninsula

title: great operation lacking in after care
body: I was treated well by the man who carried out the operations to remove cataracts from both my eyes, the operations were successful, after the first operation I had an appointment to check the progress and everything was fine, at the time of the second operation the person who carried out the operation told the nurse to book me in for an appointment in 2 weeks time, he said there are no opticians open to check so I needed an appointment at Optegra, I did not receive any letter to with an appointment so yesterday I sent them an email, Optegra phoned me and told me there are no appointments due to the coronavirus, the same was true at the time of my operation but my operation went ahead as the surgeon said they did not want to put strain on the eye that had already been operated on and checked. I was very pleased with the operations the aftercare this time is not very good, I understand there is a virus, but shops are still open to sell food, chemists are open, so I am disappointed that there was no check up, I was asked if I have any problems but I am not a professional and I may not notice things that a professional would notice. The man and woman who checked my eyes before and after the first operation were friendly and efficient. Its a pity that the information was not the same from everyone and no one wrote to inform me they will not check my eyes until June or July, they informed me initially that the first 6 weeks are the most important

title: Great experience
body:
I was worried attending the surgery due to Covid19, however the measures in place for only essential appts was brilliant, I felt totally safe and had no concerns, the staff are doing an amazing job keeping themselves and patients safe.  You were only let in if you had an appointment and that was great, I was the only patient in the waiting room.
Today was a great experience, thanks for doing a great job, stay safe.
Lesley is a great nurse, and it’s always great to see her, thanks as always for giving me my B12 boost.

title: Extremely Poor Service
body:
I have been with this GP Practice for 4 years now and I can say that, even though there have been a few minor improvements in the last year, the service is very poor and the staff is either ignorant, lacks training or purely ignorant (with a few exceptions). With just a few positive interactions, I am truly disappointed in the service provided.
      I have brain cancer and even though I was feeling poorly (was dizzy, had extremely poor vision, lack of appetite and numbness), I have been denied appointments (even call back from a GP).
      Another big problem is that I don't have just one GP- I am seeing different GP's every time (when I can actually get to see one) and most of the time they are not fully aware of my health problems (which is normal with the extremely high volume of patients as they are human). 
     Even though I have severe allergies to medication and have repeatedly informed the staff, they failed to put that anywhere on my records (after numerous reminders from my part they finally wrote down just one of my many medication allergies).
      I have been given the wrong medication due to misdiagnosis a couple of times - once even got to Royal Derby Hospital with a severe infection due to that (in that specific context, I have spoken with three GP's over the course of one month- no appointment as I could not get one, went there first thing in the morning). Doctors rushed trough the consultation- which was a maximum of 4 minutes long, the time they used to switch me to another medication without any medical tests. 
     I can understand the high amount of stress NHS and GP Practices are under, however, people lives are at stake and they should stop receiving patients if they are not equipped to deal with the high volume of people. 
     I have tried to discuss this with various members of staff but these led nowhere. Sadly, I've heard this is a countrywide issue and GP practices are lowering their standards every day. Too bad that this kind of practice is giving a bad reputation to the good doctors and medical staff that might also work there. I would like to believe this is not a malicious trend but rather a lack of training and the result of bad management. I would have liked to think it was just me but, after seeing the comments and after talking with other patients, it seems it's not just me.
      In the end, I would like to express my gratitude and respect to all those that, despite the stress and pressure, are still trying their best and apologise if I have offended anyone- this was not my intent.

title: So disappointed
body:
After several visits / tests undertaken in eye casualty, I was admitted to Ward 20 with a serious infection. Having never ever been in hospital before I was understandably frightened but I was assured i would be looked after. I spent 5 days in hospital in total and I’m sorry to say it wasn’t pleasant. 

Given the current circumstances going on in the world the ward had minimal patients (emergencies only) but still a lot of staff, so I expected the care level to be even higher. I had to have intensive treatment of eye drops every 30 mins (all through the night) this was my only treatment and yet the nurses (on the week days) had to reminded every hour to give me my treatment, which in the middle of the night became very tedious! 
I sat for nearly 3 hours at one point waiting for drops. 

Given the current pandemic everyone is praising the NHS and I have to say the doctors that dealt with me (and 2 of the nurses) were truly amazing but the rest of the nursing staff were beyond a joke and did not make patients feel at ease at all; they were lazy, uninterested, focussed more on gossiping about the current covid situation, what pictures they could put on social media to get praise for their work and more interested in getting their free food. 

On my last day a trainee nurse was in charge of giving me my treatment, he was completely incompetent - he was unaware of which drops I needed and when and had to be reminded constantly. He even forgot to collect my prescriptions and therefore it took 5 hours longer to be discharged! 

I was told I had to be in hospital for the best treatment but frankly I could have done better in the comfort and safety of my own home. 

I understand times are difficult but patients deserve the best possible care when having to stay in hospital.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: The best surgeon s best doctor best hospital
body: Thanku all Nurses doctors surgeon s who looked after me my lung infection for 2 years I had fluid of lung yellow I new what it was I had drained by Digital machine clever device all I went though hell and back well am still here thanks to this hospital and the best surgeon nurses doctor s all smart they no how to do there jobs perfectly clean hospital all times clean beds changed all times floors clean d all times food 100 percent percent I would not be here if it was not for certain person at w shaw back in 2017 we both spoke to each other about surgery Thoursic surgery I had end of 2019 October 06 surgeon s did perfect my lungs stay d up mite have staples in but still needed doing in 2017 I I'd mit I was bit scared of having this done then my lung kept going down every time so I come back to the best hospital then talk t to top man then I had to come in then I had my operation lung surgery done thanku all you doctors nurse s surgeon s you are very hard worker s I won't forget what you did for me what other hospital could not do only w shaw hospital the best all stay safe as well where mask gloves safety for your self's vampire bats disease you all deserve more than gold medal s the highest thanku team you all be safe 👍

title: Amazing staff
body:
I had to go to A & E yesterday for acute tonsillitis. The 3 ladies in reception were kind & lovely. Gave me a glass of water & did my checks then sent me off to the ACC department, security were also really kind in showing me where to go bearing in mind that I could hardly talk & was on my own. ACC were organised & I wanted to say an extra special thank you to the junior nurse Ria who looked after me. She was kind & lovely & I was in & out within 6 hours. My ear nose & throat specialist was also very efficient. Well done NGH in this hard time. 
Kind Regards 
Kerry Kilner

title: This is a an exceptional and first class practice…
body:
I have always been able to get an appointment at this practice on the day I call. Additonally, they have a very good online booking service which is easy to use. 
The staff (both medical and admin) are friendly and professional. Even during this difficult time when the Coronovirus is having an impact, I ordered a repeat prescription on the morning of 1 April, and the local pharmacy called me in the afternoon to say it was ready for collection. 

Although my last visit to the surgery was in December 2019, I have chosen to write the review now following the ordering of my repeat prescription. The review scores relate to my visit in December 2019.

title: Very Diligent Staff
body: Everyone at the practice is very helpful and kind. Whenever I have called the surgery, the reception staff have gone above and beyond to be helpful, and to answer my questions. They are very polite and always respectful of everyone. The GPs and the nurse are also very professional and knowledgeable, and they really listen. Everyone at the practice is very hardworking. I appreciate their hard work in maintaining the surgery in the current difficult circumstances.  Many of us are at home and aren't allowed to work right now. It is commendable that the staff at Premier Medical Centre are continuing to work hard, for the benefit of the community. Thank you. Sincerely, Saba

title: Superb service
body: Due to Covid-19 I was very dubious I would get seen or get much needed medication for the very bad earache I was presenting with.   After filling in the form with my symptoms I was contacted by phone by a doctor.   I was then sent a prescription to my local chemist which my wife picked up for me 30 minutes later.   I just want to say a big thank you to the staff at Steeton and Silsden surgery for having the time to triage and continue to care for all their patients in the difficult circumstances we find ourselves in at the moment

title: Amazing staff
body: I had a very tragic experience and the staff was lovely. I fell pregnant and me and my partner decided we wasn’t ready and decided to terminate the abortion at home. In the end I lost 2 litres of blood and nearly died. I had to go into surgery and get blood transfusions. I was only 19 and my parents didn’t know anything until I was admitted to the ward. All of the nurses were lovely and took extra care for myself. I had many events throughout that week I was there where I was petrified of what was to come next. One specific nurse came in on her shift early to make sure I was okay as she was very concerned about me. She made me feel very safe and secure in this scary time. I wish I remembered her name so I could thank her personally. In these hard time’s for the NHS I wish each and every member well-being and thank you for all of your hard work. So much of respect goes out to each and everyone of you ❤️

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
